[docs]class MyFEformulation(FEformulation):
    '''
    Defines a user FE formulation
    '''

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        # Number of stress/deformation components
        self.p_nstr=6
        # Number of Gauss points
        self.ns=1

    

[docs]    def generalized_epsilon(self,v):
        """
        Set user's generalized deformation vector
        """
        gde=[
            Dx(v[0],0),                 #gamma_11
            Dx(v[1],1),                 #gamma_22
            Dx(v[2],2),                 #gamma_33
            Dx(v[1],2)+Dx(v[2],1),      #gamma_23
            Dx(v[0],2)+Dx(v[2],0),      #gamma_13
            Dx(v[0],1)+Dx(v[1],0),      #gamma_12
            ]
        return as_vector(gde)

    

[docs]    def create_element(self,cell):
        """
        Set desired element
        """
        # Defines a Lagrangian FE of degree 1 for the displacements
        element_disp=VectorElement("Lagrange",cell,degree=1,dim=3)
        return element_disp  



[docs]class right(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
        return abs(x[0] - 1.)<=DOLFIN_EPS_LARGE

  

[docs]class left(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self,x,on_boundary):
        return abs(x[0] - 0.)<=DOLFIN_EPS_LARGE

  

[docs]class top(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self,x,on_boundary):
        return abs(x[2] - 5.)<=DOLFIN_EPS_LARGE

  

[docs]class bottom(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
        return abs(x[2] - 0.)<=DOLFIN_EPS_LARGE

     

[docs]class front(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self,x,on_boundary):
        return abs(x[1] - 1.)<=DOLFIN_EPS_LARGE

  

[docs]class back(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
        return abs(x[1] - 0.)<=DOLFIN_EPS_LARGE  

        

[docs]class PS_FEproblem(UserFEproblem):
    """
    Defines a user FE problem for given FE formulation
    """

[docs]    def __init__(self,FEformulation):
        self.description="Example of 2D plain strain problem, Cauchy continuum"
        self.hh = 1.
        self.hd = 1.
        self.hv = 5.
        
        self.nx = 2
        self.ny = 2#int(self.nx*(self.hd/self.hh))
        self.nz = 5#int(self.nx*(self.hv/self.hh))
        super().__init__(FEformulation)

[docs]    def set_general_properties(self):
        """
        Set here all the parameters of the problem, except material properties 
        """
        self.genprops=General_FEproblem_properties()
        # Number of state variables
        self.genprops.p_nsvars=38

    

[docs]    def create_mesh(self):
        """
        Set mesh and subdomains 
        """
        # Generate mesh       
#         mesh = RectangleMesh(Point(-self.hh/2.,-self.hv/2.),Point(self.hh/2.,self.hv//2.),self.nx,self.ny,"crossed")
        mesh=BoxMesh(Point(0*self.hh,0*self.hd,0*self.hv),Point(1*self.hh,1*self.hd,1*self.hv),self.nx,self.ny,self.nz)
#         info(mesh)
        #print(mesh.topology().dim())
        cd=MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim())
        fd=MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim()-1)
        return mesh,cd,fd

    

    

[docs]    def create_subdomains(self,mesh):
        """
        Create subdomains by marking regions
        """
        subdomains = MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim())
        subdomains.set_all(0) #assigns material/props number 0 everywhere
#         imperfection=Imperfection()
#         imperfection.mark(subdomains, 1) #assigns material/props number 1 to the imperfection
        return subdomains



[docs]    def mark_boundaries(self,boundaries):
        """
        Mark left and right boundary points
        """
        boundaries.set_all(0)
        fc={"top":1,
                 "bottom":2,
                 "left":3,
                 "right":4,
                 "back":5,
                 "front":6,} 
        self.fc=fc
        top0=top()
        top0.mark(boundaries,fc["top"])
        bottom0=bottom()
        bottom0.mark(boundaries,fc["bottom"])
        left0=left()
        left0.mark(boundaries,fc["left"])
        right0=right()
        right0.mark(boundaries,fc["right"])
        back0=back()
        back0.mark(boundaries,fc["back"])
        front0=front()
        front0.mark(boundaries,fc["front"])
        return    

    
    

[docs]    def set_bcs(self):
        """
        Set boundary conditions for the user problem / could be replaced by external mesher, e.g. Abaqus, Gmsh...
        """
        u_n=-10e-2
        u_t=0#.1*u_n
        axial_displ=1
        frc=0.
        
#         BCtype = {
#             "DC": 0, #Dirichlet: increment proportionally to step time
#             "DC-C": 2, #Dirichlet: set at the beginning and keep constant
#             "NM": 1, #Neumann: increment proportionally to step time
#             "NM-C": 3, #Neumann: set at the beginning and keep constant
#             "RB": 5, #Robin
#             "NM-n": 6, #Neumann: normal to the boundary traction (pressure); increment proportionally to step time
#             "NM-n-C": 7, #Neumann: normal to the boundary traction (pressure); set at the biginning and keep constant
#             }
        BC_DC=self.BCtype["DC"]
        fc=self.fc
        
        bcs = [
                #top
                [fc["top"], [BC_DC, [2], axial_displ]],            
                #bottom
#                 [2, [0, [0], 0.]],
#                 [2, [0, [1], 0.]],
                [fc["bottom"], [BC_DC, [2], 0.]],
                #left
#                 [3, [0, [0], 0.]],
#                 [3, [1, [0], frc]],
#                 [3, [1, [1], frc]],
#                 [3, [1, [2], frc]],
                #right
#                 [4, [0, [0], 0.]],
#                 [4, [1, [0], frc]],
#                 [4, [1, [1], frc]],
#                 [4, [1, [2], frc]],
                #back
#                 [5, [0, [1], 0.]],
#                 [5, [1, [0], frc]],
#                 [5, [1, [1], frc]],
#                 [5, [1, [2], frc]],
                #front
#                 [6, [0, [1], 0.]],
#                 [6, [1, [0], frc]],
#                 [6, [1, [1], frc]],
#                 [6, [1, [2], frc]],
                ]
        return bcs



[docs]    def set_materials(self):
        """
        Create material objects and set material parameters
        """
        mats=[]
        # load material #1
        env_lib=ngeo_parameters.env_lib
        
        umat_lib = ngeo_parameters.umat_lib_path + '/CAUCHY3D-DP/libplast_Cauchy3D-DP.so'
        #'/home/filippomasi/git/numerical_geolab_materials/UMATERIALS/CAUCHY3D-DP/libplast_Cauchy3D-DP.so'
        umat_id=3       # if many materials exist in the same library
        
        mat=UserMaterial(env_lib,umat_lib,umat_id)
        E_param = 200.e+3
        v_param = 0.3
#         print((1e-3)*E_param*(1-v_param)/((1+v_param)*(1-2*v_param)))
        K_param = E_param / (3 * (1 - 2 * v_param) )
        G_param = E_param / (2 * (1 + v_param) )
        S_param = 10000000.
        H_param = 0.
        mat.props=self.set_material_1_properties(K_param,G_param,S_param,H_param)
                
        mats.append(mat)
        return mats

    


[docs]    def set_material_1_properties(self,K,G,c,H,eta=0.):
        """
        Sets material parameters
        """ 
        props=np.zeros(19)
        props[0]=K
        props[1]=G
        props[11]=c
#         props[10]=tanphi
#         props[12]=tanpsi
        props[14]=H
        props[18]=0
        props=props.astype("double")
        return props


if __name__ == "__main__":
    import dolfin as df
    print (df.__version__)
    
    tic = time.perf_counter()
    My_FEformulation=MyFEformulation()
    my_FEproblem=PS_FEproblem(My_FEformulation)
    
    saveto="./PS_ref_Cauchy_3D.xdmf"#/mnt/f/DEVELOPMENT/1DFORFENICS/res/test2D.xdmf"
    # start_time = time.time()
    # converged=my_FEproblem.solve(saveto)
    # print("Process",my_FEproblem.comm.Get_rank(),"--- %s seconds ---" % (time.time() - start_time))
    my_FEproblem.slv.dtmax = .2
    # my_FEproblem.slv.convergence_tol = 1.e-4#         ann_folder="/home/filippomasi/eclipse-workspace/TANN_net_PlaneStrain_Elastic_2021-04-28"
    my_FEproblem.slv.nitermax = 10
    my_FEproblem.slv.nincmax = 1000 
    converged=my_FEproblem.solve(saveto,silent=False,summary=False)
    toc = time.perf_counter()
    print(f"time {toc - tic:0.4f} seconds")
